summary: Team confirmed readiness to begin work; Architect reports no blockers. Action items assigned: PM to confirm priorities, Architect to verify dependencies, Developer to start implementation, and QA requires expected output in handoffs for testing.

decisions.title: Team ready to start work
decisions.details: All attendees confirmed they are ready to begin implementation and testing work.

decisions.title: Architecture has no blockers
decisions.details: Architect (Mike) reported no blockers on the architecture side; proceed pending dependency confirmations.

decisions.title: Handoffs must include expected output for QA
decisions.details: QA (Jordan) required that every handoff include the expected output so tests can be executed immediately when items are marked 'Ready for testing'.

sign_offs.what: Confirmed readiness and requested priority direction
Confirmed no architecture blockers and requested dependency confirmation
Confirmed readiness to test and specified handoff requirements

actions.task: Confirm and communicate priority list of implementation tasks to the dev team
Confirm any outstanding dependencies or explicitly give the go-ahead if none exist
Begin implementation on highest-priority tasks once PM confirms priorities; include Expected output in each handoff to QA
Ensure every 'Ready for testing' handoff includes clear Expected output and test notes for QA

backlog_deltas.title: Implementation tasks: add prioritized development tickets to backlog per PM guidance
QA handoff template: add a task to create/update handoff checklist including Expected output field

risks.risk: Unconfirmed external or inter-team dependencies may block implementation
risks.mitigation: Architect (Mike) to confirm dependencies immediately and escalate unresolved dependencies to PM for follow-up

risks.risk: Incomplete handoffs (missing expected output) will delay testing and regress cycles
risks.mitigation: Require Expected output in every handoff; assign devs to populate it and PM to enforce through acceptance criteria

risks.risk: Lack of prioritized tasks may cause developer idle time or wrong task selection
risks.mitigation: PM (Sarah) to publish a clear priority list before development continues and reassign as needed
